astNode.text: Thanks, my logcat seems pretty uninformative, but I added it.

node.contents: I have an application which displays a series of custom views in a LinearLayout. The LinearLayout is in a ScrollView. The custom views draw a picture, when their onDraw method is called. Generally this works fine. But occasionally the application crashes on a drawPicture() call. When it crashes, no exception seems to be thrown, but I do get this message in logcat: "Wrote stack trace to 'data/anr/traces.txt'".

astNode.text: I have an application which displays a series of custom views in a LinearLayout. The LinearLayout is in a ScrollView. The custom views draw a picture, when their onDraw method is called. Generally this works fine. But occasionally the application crashes on a drawPicture() call. When it crashes, no exception seems to be thrown, but I do get this message in logcat: "Wrote stack trace to 'data/anr/traces.txt'".

node.contents: Sounds like it's not drawPicture() that's causing the issue, but something else in your application.

astNode.text: Sounds like it's not drawPicture() that's causing the issue, but something else in your application.

node.contents: thank you. could you provide any insight on why I am getting this ANR on my drawPicture() call? It's confusing because it occurs randomly, often the same Picture draws fine... then randomly produces this ANR.

astNode.text: thank you. could you provide any insight on why I am getting this ANR on my drawPicture() call? It's confusing because it occurs randomly, often the same Picture draws fine... then randomly produces this ANR.

node.contents: are you calling Thread.sleep() in any where? why don't you try drawBitmap ?? I am making a game with this and I am drawing too many pictures even animation but I don't have any problem yet.

astNode.text: are you calling Thread.sleep() in any where? why don't you try drawBitmap ?? I am making a game with this and I am drawing too many pictures even animation but I don't have any problem yet.

node.contents: I hope till now you have found some good solution, if yes then I request you to please share your knowledge. Thanks very much

astNode.text: I hope till now you have found some good solution, if yes then I request you to please share your knowledge. Thanks very much

node.contents: This is not a crash, it's an ANR (Application Not Responding.) It means your application is taking too long to respond to an event (more than 5 seconds.)

astNode.text: This is not a crash, it's an ANR (Application Not Responding.) It means your application is taking too long to respond to an event (more than 5 seconds.)
